intro: Scabiosa serrata, commonly known as the saw-toothed scabious, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its clusters of small, pink or white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has serrated leaves that give it its common name, and it typically grows in dry, sunny habitats. Scabiosa serrata is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with showy blooms. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
